history.content:
You sound like you're in the exact same position that I was in. I am currently in CS 170 and it was fairly easy (for me, maybe not others) to get in as a sophomore. Because I was not declared while taking CS 70, I was forced to waitlist into the class, but I comfortably got in during the adjustment period as I wait listed during phase 1. 

Being on the waitlist definitely means that no one can guarantee you enrollment. But, the earlier you waitlist into the class, the better your chances are for getting in.

I'm a CS intended freshman and would ideally like to do CS 170 sophomore spring (since I hear it's useful for interviews/internships and stuff). Doing 61B now, plan on doing 70 either sophomore fall or this summer.

Anyone have experience with getting into (or not) 170 as a sophomore after doing 70 in the fall? I hear declarations sometimes take time to process so priority won't go through in time for spring enrollment. I'd rather not do 70 in the summer, and I'd really like to get 170 done before junior year.

Any thoughts? Thanks!
history.subject: Getting into CS 170 the semester after declaring
